Reviews.Title: “Clean but small”
Reviews.Author: indianqueen39
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, staff freindly and helpful. Bus stop 2 mins away to take you into the centre of Singapore. Room too small!!!

Reviews.Title: “Service is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: itzjoanna
Reviews.Content: We are really grateful to their staff, especially Alex, for accommodating us for our erratic travel timings. Staff like Alex was really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “very clean tiny room, perfect for a rest, a nap, a night.”
Reviews.Author: eldag
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Singapore around 5 am and our next flight was at 3 pm.so we decided to book a room in this hotel and rest. The room is tiny with a tiny bathroom but very clean, not far from the airport and so perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Not very accessible by MRT, but close enough to airport by taxi”
Reviews.Author: kkua
Reviews.Content: Small room... slightly larger than the pod rooms you find in Japan. It's about 2m wide and 5m long with the included shower/bathroom. Room21 is on the patio, so there's no air conditioning until you get into the room. Speaking of which, you cannot substitute room's keycard to activate the air conditioning unit. So, you cannot leave the room to cool down while you're out getting dinner. The savings in room rates does not make up for transportation costs and lost time getting to the property.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for a very short stay - by yourself”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeVulture
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks quaint, the name actually quite suits it . . . this is where it ends, however. It is a business hotel if you need to be in this area or if Singapore hotel prices scare you, especially if it is your own company. The rooms are quite tiny and the bathrooms even tinier, even in proportion. Using the toilet required some gymnastics - admittedly I am 6'2 (186cm) . . . The room smelled of smoke and there was a general dampness to the place. The staff are quite friendly without being professional . . . all in all it was an ok place to stay for two nights as my business meetings were just around the corner

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: Dadkat
Reviews.Content: Everything is excellent except of the location... best value for money..

Reviews.Title: “second stay here...not so good”
Reviews.Author: qprjames
Reviews.Content: the positives....price....thats about all really. singapore is v.expensive. hotel location isnt great. mrt is too far to walk. taxi is cheap however into cbd. matress was really comfy but i found 4 hairs in the bed. i had a long flight and was too tired to change rooms. yuck! the carpet was also dirty not too mention the state of the bedroom walls, with masking tape covering holes in the wall....says it all really!. in the morning the cleaners woke me up chatting outside the room at 8am mad worse by the fact the corridors are narrow and the rooms are all bunched together. i coudnt get back to sleep as there was a massive skylight beaming daylight directly onto my head! (rm22) last stay was average/ok. i definately woudnt stay again. pay a bit more and go and stay in an ibis or mercure hotel and sleep happy. or i'd recommend the transit airport hotel, as its very very cheap, and lots of things to do in changi airport (public cinema, pool etc)

Reviews.Title: “Small, smelly and incompetent staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rooroo29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and chose the hotel due to reviews we had read on here! Big mistake - yes we knew it would be small but that does not prepare you for the room that you will encounter. We travelled with 2 suitcases which we could not fit into the room at all. There was barely room for both us to stand up at the same time. Our first room was inconviently situated under the air vent to the smoking area on the roof top. The room stank of cigarette smoke! Thankfully the hotel changed our room but the smell of cigrarettes could still be smelt! The most unforgiveable part of our stay at this hotel was the debarcle over our wake up call and taxi booking for our flight. We aksed the staff to book us a taxi and give us a wake up call at 6am, We were awoken form our sleep at 11.45 to clarify what kind of taxi we wanted, (which was never booked for us!!) and then did not receive our wake up call! A complete an utter mess up in my opinion. If you don't mind overly cramped rooms and approx 25 minute bus trip into tourist area then this is teh hotel for you! Be warned though the rooms do not look like teh pictures shown on their website!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet good location no tv no window”
Reviews.Author: Deco66
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking and was almost half the price to book on the internet as they had posted in the lobby. Clean quiet with no TV. Can't expect too much for the price. shower was great no complaints. For a stopover trip where I won't spend much time in the room this is great. Plenty of restaurants and convenience stores around and looks like a great neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Small but quality hotel. Clean, Safe and Free Wifi, yippee!”
Reviews.Author: Fuldashop
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just a night because it's near airport. Too bad, if I know that it's this good, I might have selected to stay here since day 1 that we were here. Location is no problem for me. We can always take taxi to places. Nearby are many restaurants, all looks good, too bad, we have no time to try them all. However, already decided if I come back Singapore in the future, I'll stay here again. Only drawback I'd have about here, is that they don't have elevators for all buildings. To my understanding, some rooms can have elevator access but my wing has no elevator access. Free Wi-Fi in room, that's quite fast and perfect. Small room but OK. I like that they have cleaning faucet for toilet too!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad room, but location was a bit of an issue”
Reviews.Author: aqchin
Reviews.Content: My mom and I were put in a standard room with a double bed. The room was quite small and did not have any chairs to sit on which was quite frustrating. Also, the air conditioning wasnt very powerful hence my sleep wasnt as comfortable as it should have been. The room does have a slight musky smell, probably due to poor ventilation. The television is attached to the wall, but it can only be watched from the head of the bed because of the angle it was positioned. The channels were pretty limited. The good stuff were that it is clean, they change your towels everyday (not sure about the sheets), and they provided us with 2 bottles of complimentary water each day. There is free wifi, but i was unable to access it from my room, only when i was in the lobby. The lobby is unimpressive as it is so small and there is no where to sit. It can literally only accommodate 4 or 5 people. Not very practical. There are quite a few good food places around the hotel though, the best one being the Beach Rd Prawn Mee (apparently a popular one with the locals). Other good things include the bus stop being walking distance to the hotel, with buses going straight to orchard rd. But the closest MRT is Eunos, which is still 20 minutes away, and not really walking distance, hence pretty inconvenient. Overall, I would recommend Le Peranakan to people who are confident with traveling and exploring singapore with ample time, but not for those who want to be close to the city centre (Le Peranakan is approx. a 35 - 40 minute (peak time) or 25 - 30 minute (off-peak) bus ride from Orchard Rd)

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms but Great Quality!”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous1337
Reviews.Content: The Single Room was rather tight, but I really didn't mind because everything else was perfect. Definitely an A with cleanliness and hygiene. Toilet, carpet and sheets were almost pristine in condition. Plenty of food and pubs downstairs and along the street. The famous Beach Road Prawn Mee down the road is a must-try. Moving around is pretty easy too as there are direct buses to Orchard Road and City Hall, amongst other hotspots. Housekeeping is done every day, which include fresh floor mat, bath and face towel changes as well as daily bottled water supply. There are usually one or two staff members on duty each time, but they do very well in responding to the customers' every need. Another plus point is the free, unlimited WIFI internet facility. It is fast and stable, unlike paid internet services from other hotels. One of the best budget hotels that I've stayed in. Highly recommended if you don't mind the space constraints!

Reviews.Title: “Small but conventient”
Reviews.Author: chweehar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just less than 10min. from the airport and is on the main road of East Coast Rd. There are quite a few good eating places around this hotel. eg. East Coast Lagoon Food Village,Katong Laksa,Tian Tian chicken rice ........ The room is very small so is the shower , just a word of warning please make sure your room window is locked before you leave the room ,because the window is quite easily reach from the ground floor if someone were to trying to break in. The staff are quite friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Average but good”
Reviews.Author: ApurvaTurakhia
Reviews.Content: Nice location in Singapore. Their cheapest rooms do not have windows. They are so small that I under estimated it completely. I travelled with my son and his stroller and 3 bags. I couldnt even get 1 bag in there. Had to keep as a pile and 2 bags in their store room. They fit in a bed with hardly 1 feet of walking space around it before you end up in a small bathroom. Their superior rooms would be more roomy but I can't comment. Their day-time manager couldnt upgrade us because none higher end rooms were available.. neither could he move us to some little better window less rooms (apparently they have of different sizes). At night, another manager was there (a lady) who was super duper nice to us. She realized that it is a nightmare to stay in that small gibber room. Although she wouldnt upgrade us to higher grade room, she was kind enough to give us a room for Physically challenged. So since you need to have access for wheel chair, atleast the room size grew and we got some space. What a relief. Most of the lower end rooms in Singapore are small and incredibly small. So this is nothing indifferent. I would suggest this hotel for other better reasons and bigger rooms if available.. For solo travellers with just a Backpack this room is also ideal and cheap. For Indian families, I would suggest Claremont Hotel in little India area where they would get Indian food and bigger rooms for same price. Away from main downtown. Takes 10SGD to reach from Marina Bay hotel. Buses to go to MRT stations and downtown available nearby. Amazing mexican, Italian and Thai restaurant below. Lot of other local food options nearby as well. Restaurants are very pricey and expensive.. but amazing food.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay there !”
Reviews.Author: Conquestador1971
Reviews.Content: What a terrible stay. Aircon constantly breaking down. No-One answering at reception. Ladies of the night everywhere. This is not a family hotel. You have been warned. Rooms far too small. We had bare electrical cables where wall lights once were. Covered with a sliver of masking tape.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY REALLY SMALL ROOM”
Reviews.Author: mosnas
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Le Peranakan because of cheap price, but when we saw our room, it was really really small. Its impossible that 2 person can walk in the room at the same time. My wife must wait on bed, until im finish. There´s only one bed and the aircondition is directly above the bed. The cold wind comes directly on you during night. The roomservice didnt clean our room one night. You should spent litte more money and choose another hotel. Its absolutly not comfortable to stay in this hotel. Only if you´re alone, maybee it works. Its a chinese hotel and all rooms are same size.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique style, average experience”
Reviews.Author: Peter073
Reviews.Content: This is a small charming hotel about 10 minutes from central Singapore by car. The rooms are tiny and therefore I would only recommend this for solo business travellers. The broadband was fine and free. The area had some nice little coffe shops and bars as well as a service station a tire shop etc. There was an area of historic shop fronts a few blocks away. We paid $120 per night for a superior room because we def wanted a room with a window. I'd happily stay here again if I had to, but not by choice. I think you can do better and get a bigger room in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnsonbar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the east side, near to East Coast Park, so is roughly equidistant between Changi airport and the usual concentration of downtown hotels (Marina City, Little India, Chinatown, etc). Although this makes it out of the way for downtown nightlife and shopping, it is beside or near many restaurants and bars, especially if you include the beach area (behind the McDonalds) which is only a 10 minute walk away (beyond Marine Parade, Marine Terrace). There are also attractive jogging and biking routes through the beachside (East Coast) park. So location for many purposes is very good except for shopping. The rooms are on the small side, about half of which do not have windows, but this is noted when you reserve through the hotel's own website. Prices, however, are attractive or at least competitive with many other budget hotels. From my experience, this one is particularly clean, well maintained (fresh paint, no signs of overdue maintenance), and has free internet access which worked well for me. Although breakfast is not included, it is available inexpensively just across the street. Taxis are incredibly abundant on both streets (East Coast Road, Telok Kurau Rd). After staying in dozens of hotels in Singapore for 20 years, from Changi all the way out to Boon Lay, this place was a pleasant surprise to me. For example it is well above the standard of the "81" hotels as well as being quite superior in cleanliness and room condition (although not size) to the Albert Court Village Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: gailforce4
Reviews.Content: The rooms are really small, the bed takes up nearly the entire space, but at least there are windows which are double glazed to keep out the noise. The pictures on their website make it look a lot bigger and nicer than it really is. Cleanliness wise it was fine. We stayed here because it was cheap-ish and not too far from the airport. There's a few bars and restaurants in the vicinity, but it is a good 20 minute walk from the nearest train station. The corridors reeked of cigarette smoke and the staff were not particularly friendly or helpful. If you only need an overnight transit stop it's fine, but if staying for longer I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A Last Resort ...”
Reviews.Author: OrangOrangGila
Reviews.Content: It was a couple months back that we stayed at this hotel ... have just returned from traveling :) Singapore is famous for its small expensive hotels ... but I am surprised how pristine clean and groomed Singapore has so many dirt and well-worn hotels!! Le Peranakan Hotel was no exception to this ... but what made it worse was that we had to be in Singapore on the one weekend that they were hosting the Formula 1 races ... so all the hotels jacked up the prices and Le Peranakan Hotel doubled in price (we had to pay $140SIN / Night) which made it hurt more. It is in a safe area, you can get a bus/subway into town ... taxi is easier ... if you just need a place to crash on a quick layover ... then fine, but bring a sleep sheet! Room are your typical Singapore small with a cramped bathroom complete with glass door. Personally, I think that the China Town area is better and via taxi to/from the airport is no more difficult to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Budget price, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Tawfik00
Reviews.Content: One star extra for the hotel service is deserved. My small room was clean and comfortable. You can get into the city by bus, there are some bus stop around. The staff was kind and friendly, ready to help if I needed. Excellent price in Singapore. If you need a budget price for accomodation, this would meet you. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but worth the price..”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0021
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends went to Sg and stayed at Le Peranakan. They dont have the best facilities but definitely worth the price that we paid. Service crew were ok especially Nas I have to mention his name he's very helpful with our tour.. I would recommend this hotel for those who are traveling with minimal budget like us.:) the near buy coffee shop Food r Us is also great! Publi tr

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: Munchgal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there whilst our house was undergoing renovation. Overall, it was a satisfactory stay especially for the price we paid (Below S$100 per night). In total we stayed there for 3 weeks which in such a small room can get quite depressing. As per what the other reviews have mentioned, the room is EXTREMELY small, but we did manage to put our bags in there though you'd have to stack them one on top of the other. The bathrooms were alrite but only big enough at any one time for one person only. I didnt use the toiletries. The bed was comfortable enough though the cupboard space was hardly sufficient to hang our clothes. We'd only have enough to hang perhaps 2 days worth of clothes. Overall, it was clean and the receptionist was very nice to always provide us with an extra pillow. Location-wise its pretty far from town, but around the hotel, it has very nice eateries and bus stops with buses that could bring you practically anywhere in Singapore. The price is really the only selling point and is acceptable if you are not staying in the room too long due to its small size and is the only hotel within that price range that is not near the red light district. Just make sure to get rooms away from the front and back as there is a karaok pub downstairs and some rooms can hear the rather unprofessional singing late into the night.

Reviews.Title: “If what you're looking for is privacy... Then this hotel is NOT for you.”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Teddies
Reviews.Content: The positive side - Le Peranakan is a small, family-run, cosy little inn tucked snuggly away from the city (but is easily accessible in 10 minutes by taxi or bus). Its priced reasonably, room is squeaky clean (its new) and food is a stone's throw away. And the front office staff? Very accommodating and friendly. Perfect for backpackers and solo travellers. This is, at the expense of.................... Its sheer size. The rooms are really small and unless you're travelling alone or you're midgets or mini-rodents, this hotel cannot give adult-sized people, families or people with luggages a run for their money. The rooms are too cramped up - the bed is wall to wall, the cupboard covers the way to the room sink, the top of the cupboard blocks half of the air-condition, no windows and hardly any space to walk without bumping into your roommate. Worse of all, they do not respect your privacy. Without knocking on your door or just checking if there are people in the room, their housekeeping staff entered my room. I was in total shock because i could've been in anything (or nothing!) at that time and they violate my most basic need for privacy in my room, as a guest in their hotel. The entire day after that, i was left worrying who will barge into my room next! It was a complete nightmare! I left that very night when the incident happened and vowed never to return. It could've been an isolated case, but i'm not taking chances - there wasn't any apology offered either. If you're thinking of this staying here and don't mind such things happening to you, then by all means, it is a great, spanking clean and convenient hotel. Very good for backpackers especially (but its not cheap or budget!). Otherwise, i would recommend a better establishment for a couple more dollars, right smack in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious.”
Reviews.Author: SCandCS
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to sleep, well, it's comfortable. If you thought the ambience - from the website - look grand then you will be disappointed. It was like being in Hotel 81 with a little class. A dark plum colour for that romantic look (which is so cliche), embroidered curtains to add some class, 'antique' peranakan furniture (the chair in my room was broken!!! Urgh...) to spice it up and the flowery carpet for that fake final grand look. Not all is bad. The toilet is clean though the toiletries were not complete. I must agree that the reception is PATHETIC! Asked for extra pillow but declined because all the rooms are full.... Hello...? Connection please...?

Reviews.Title: “New, clean but small and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Member88
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 days stay in Le Perankan and we totally agree with the previous two reviewers. The hotel is located on the upper level of 2 rows of renovated shophouses built probably in the early 1900s, in the style of the Peranakan (ala Baba - mixed race of Chinese and Muslims). It is well located in the East Coast/Katong area with lots of good restaurants around, serving nice hawker style food at very reasonable prices. East Coast Parkway, where you can find an abundance of seafood restaurants and the aclaimed Singapore Chilli Crabs is just a short drive away. The hotel itself is quite new (6-9 mths) and clean, but the room is extremely small and bed too uncomfortable for our liking, esp as we have been accustomed to 5-stars comfort. The toilet and shower is so tiny that it can only fit one person. The rooms can get a bit noisy from other boarders and traffic noise below. We choosed this hotel as we were fascinated by the architecture of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but too small”
Reviews.Author: nivi83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 days. First of all none of the taxi drivers we drove with knew where it was, so remember to print out the address! When we arrived we came into reception that is so cramped that two persons with lugage has difficulty fitting in, and I am sorry to say it is the same with the room. Although we got a room facing the terrace we got very disappointed when we saw how small the room was. Our lugage took up all of the floor space so we had to jump onto the bed to get into the bathroom. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to couples travelling together only for solo travellers. Then it is a great value since the hotel is brand new, tastefully decorated and the staff is friendly. They have a small jacuzzi on the terrace that is also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Small buts gets the job done”
Reviews.Author: sygnin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. We lived in the area years ago and so wanted to stay somewhere nearby. The hotel occupies the second floors of two renovated rows of shophouses. It opened in mid-late 2009, so everything was almost brand new during our stay. The room we had was comfortable and it provided for our needs - a comfortable bed, clean sheets and a warm shower. The place is decorated to look Peranakan (an ethnic group in the region with Chinese and local Malayan cultures), though this was mostly for flavor. One building had an elevator going up from the reception to the 2nd floor. The building we stayed in did not. The rooms are small, and our bathroom in particular was strangely built - there was only a small gap between the toilet seat and the wall, and the shower door opened about halfway before colliding into the sink. The shower pressure was very strong and it took some adjusting to get it to a reasonable pressure. The walls are also rather thin - at one point a family was staying in the next room and we could hear them talking. Some rooms also have no windows, so be sure to specify your preference if you dislike the idea of a windowless room. There is free wireless internet but it was rather slow - enough to check emails but not much more. The hotel is in a nice area that is outside of the major financial and shopping districts. It is within walking distance to East Coast beach and the cultural neighborhoods of Katong and Joo Chiat. There are lots of places to eat nearby that are open at all hours of the day, and you can get a bus to town or to the nearest subway station. Or catch a cab. If you are used to staying at budget B&Bs and backpacker's, the hotel is like a newer version of such places. Is it entirely adequate at providing a comfortable place to rest at the end of a long day. If you don't intend to spend much time in the hotel, and you want to stay somewhere away from the mad rush of Orchard, then it might be a good choice.

HotelInfo.Name: Le Peranakan Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 400 East Coast Road | Katong District, Singapore 428994, Singapore
